column1: Uchi////One strange thing did occur right before we left: a young lady came with a group of friends
column2: and apparently this woman was allergic to rice.  Why they decided to bring her to Uchi
column3: I will never understand.  Why she decided to try and eat there
column4: instead of just grabbing a Jack in the Box taco on the way to dinner
column5: I will also never understand.  However
column6: she informed the waiter that she had a rice allergy
column7: and the waiter claimed that the chef refused to modify any of the rice dishes to be served without rice since that would ruin the integrity of this culinary vision.  I get it
column8: the food is perfect.  You don't eff with perfect.  Allergies
column10: are nothing to be messed with
column11: and I feel like there should have been a way to find middle ground.
